Package com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.interfaces

This package contains some interfaces, that are unique to NetCom2, but not to any sub-package So, for example, some of those interface define a bridge between 2 decoupled parts, some expanded interface of the function package, such as TriConsumer or TriPredicate, which all may be used freely outside of NetCom2.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Adapter<F,T>
    This Adapter interface takes something and turns it into anther type, as stated in the generic types.
    Factory<F,T>
    A Factory interface is used to create any Object.
    Loggable
    This interface describes, that the internally set Logging instance may be overridden separately.
    MultipleConnections
    This interface describes, that the inherited Class is capable of creating new Connections, based upon the Session.
    Mutex
    This interface provides a mechanism to acquire any Object at runtime to ensure Thread-Safety.
    ReceivePipeline<T>
    A ReceivePipeline differs from the Pipeline by the Class which they hold.
    SendBridge
    This Class is used to abstract away the Send-mechanism.
    SimpleFactory<T>
    Similarly to the Factory, this Class creates a new object, declared using the generic type upon calling the SimpleFactory.create() method.
    SocketFactory
    This Method is nearly the same as an Socket.
    SoftStoppable
    This Method defines a stoppable Action You may create a class that is inherited by Runnable and SoftStoppable to create a Runnable that you can stop using the SoftStoppable.softStop() Method.
    TriConsumer<T,U,V>
    This interface is created equally to the Consumer, but expects 3 types as arguments Its primary use is to enable the OnReceiveTriple, which is inherited by this Class
    TriPredicate<T,U,V>
    This interface is created equally to the Predicate, but excepting 3 types as arguments Its primary use is to enable the ReceivePipelineCondition, which utilizes this predicate to evaluate whether or not an OnReceiveTriple should be executed or not.

Package com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.interfaces Description

This package contains some interfaces, that are unique to NetCom2, but not to any sub-package

So, for example, some of those interface define a bridge between 2 decoupled parts, some expanded interface of the function package, such as TriConsumer or TriPredicate, which all may be used freely outside of NetCom2.

This package has the least likeliness to be altered. New additions are certainly possible, but not necessarily certain. So, you may rely on these interfaces.

Any interface annotated with @FunctionalInterface is meant to be a functional interface and will receive at best some new default-methods. If the interface you are using does not have this annotation, this interface is a functional interface by pure chance, not by design. Do not rely on those interface being a functional interface!

Note however, that using these interfaces outside of your network-layer might be a sign of bad coupling and dependency towards NetCom2.
